I've got the AVX version of MultiFloat working (yay - my MacBook Air supports AVX 1 :-)). I've
also added a simple test application as python finds it difficult to allocate an aligned MultiFloat...

Beginning work on a vectorised multi-precision model to accelerate the forcefields
in Sire. Just added an abstraction of a vectorised float.

I've finished adding the grid to FDTISingleBound.py and am now debugging. It has significantly

removed as fixed atoms.

commits.author: chryswoods@gmail.com
commits.message:
I've ported the Amber crd/top reader from Julien's branch to the main devel branch, which
meant bringing across AmberParameters and AtomCutting too. I've optimised AmberParameters as
this was causing the read times for Amber().readCrdTop() to be huge! (90 seconds versus 35 seconds).

Code seems to be working

commits.author: chryswoods@gmail.com
commits.message:
I've added a script that uses astyle to beautify the code and enforce a consistent style.
I've removed the backtrace from exception so that it is much faster (too much code relies
on throwing exceptions as part of normal operation). I've also improved the speed of
the perturbation code by removing its reliance on exceptions.

Updated the main branch to merge in the differences from Julien's branch so that 
it can run the FDTISingleBound module that I've just added to Sire.Tools
(last commit of the python wrappers)

commits.author: chryswoods@gmail.com
commits.message:
Updated python wrappers and also added in the FDTISingleBound.py module to perform
the bound leg for a protein-ligand single topology simulation

commits.author: chryswoods@gmail.com
commits.message:
Added another test of the fixed center property code. This test rotates a ligand around its center
property, and also performs internal moves on the ligand. The ligand does not drift and the center
is retained throughout the run.

commits.author: chryswoods@gmail.com
commits.message:
I've added a "center" property to the molecules that, if set, would force the rigid body MC move to
rotate around the set "center", rather than the result of the center function. The center point is
updated automatically in mover.cpp as the molecule is translated and rotated.

I've updated test/SireMove/rigidbodymc.py to demonstrate and test its use.

commits.author: chryswoods@gmail.com
commits.message:
Updated the function to automatically assign identity points so that it can work from atomic masses,
as well as atomic elements. This is to fix the case where the "element" property of a molecule has
not been set.

commits.author: nividic73@googlemail.com
commits.message: Debugging - Single topology

commits.author: chryswoods@gmail.com
commits.message:
I've added a test for the Sire.Tools.WaterChanger module that can convert TIP3P to TIP4P

Just take a look at test/Tools/testmaketip4p.py for an example. Also, I've updated
the WSRC example to switch to TIP4P (for a test)

commits.author: chryswoods@gmail.com
commits.message: I've added a function to Sire.Tools that can convert TIP3P water molecules to TIP4P water molecules.

commits.author: chryswoods@gmail.com
commits.message:
Fixed an annoying bug in AtomPairs that caused the intramolecular energy of a molecule to
be infinite if the extracted part of the molecule contained the last atom in the molecule.

commits.author: nividic73@googlemail.com
commits.message: single topology update

commits.author: chryswoods@gmail.com
commits.message:
I've finished adding the ability to save arbitrary data types as properties, e.g.
if you look at test/SireBase/testwrap.py you can see that we can now easily store
strings, integers, doubles, vectors, and arrays of all of these in a molecule. This
is really useful as it lets us save additional data to the molecule that can be
used during setup and within the high level python scripts.

Code compiles, links runs and appears to be working

commits.author: chryswoods@gmail.com
commits.message:
I've found a major bug in the WSRC module that caused free energies to be calculated
incorrectly. This is the source of the strange PMFs that I have been seeing and that
I have been debugging. The problem was that I hadn't used the correct lambda values
for the forwards and backwards energy expressions...

Also, to this I had added the ability to use a smaller reflection sphere for the ligand
and to not print out the PDBs of intermediate lambda values.

were not printed in the output PDB file.

I've also edited the python wrappers for Move so that compilation still succeeds if OpenMM
is not installed (this was to fix my install of Julien's branch on a Linux without OpenMM)

commits.author: chryswoods@gmail.com
commits.message:
Here are the python wrappers for the last commit. There are many changes caused by the
change in API from .energy(EnergyTable...) to .energyTable(EnergyTable...).

commits.author: chryswoods@gmail.com
commits.message:
I've ported across the changes from devel (adding in support for different coulomb and LJ
cutoffs in forcefields) and also added all of the other cutoff methods to IntraSoftCLJPotential.

Also, I have renamed .energy(EnergyTable...) functions to .energyTable(EnergyTable...).
This is necessary as .energy() is a reserved function name that is to be used only to 
calculate and return individual energies. Having .energy(EnergyTable...) caused many 
problems as python was not able to handle the argument overloading correctly.

commits.author: chryswoods@gmail.com
commits.message: Removed the FastInterCLJFF forcefield

commits.author: chryswoods@gmail.com
commits.message: Removed the FastInterCLJFF from SireMM

commits.author: chryswoods@gmail.com
commits.message: Fixed some compilation errors in the SSE version of the softcljpotential routines.

commits.author: chryswoods@gmail.com
commits.message:
I've cleaned up the CLJ and SoftCLJ code and have checked that all of the tests on the intra
and inter forcefields have passed (testintersoftcljff.py, testintrasoftcljff.py and testgridff.py
and testgridff2.py). It looks like all of the different cutoff schemes using different
coulomb and LJ cutoffs are working :-)

commits.author: nividic73@googlemail.com
commits.message: Update Reaction Field expression in OpenMM single topology file

commits.author: chryswoods@gmail.com
commits.message:
I've debugged and fixed problems in IntraCLJPotential and IntraSoftCLJPotential and have 
checked that the energies given by both agree with one another, and that having
different coulomb and LJ cutoffs gives the same numbers as forcefields with same
cutoffs (see test/SireMM/testintrasoftcljff.py). I will next work on a similar test
for InterCLJPotential and InterSoftCLJPotential.

Note I also found a bug in SireFF/detail/ffmolecules.cpp that meant that it crashed
when calculating intramolecular energies of molecules when the molecule had been
added to the forcefield one residue at a time. The idx_to_cgidx map was not being
updated when the atom selection was being changed.

Everything compiles, but I need to test it all ;-)
